intro: Verbesina lloensis, commonly known as the Lloengo goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Verbesina lloensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
